PARAGRAPH.STRING: is an archipelago lying in the Arctic Ocean north of mainland Europe, about midway between Norway and the North Pole.
consists of a group of islands ranging from 76° to 81° North, and 10° to 35° East.

is the northernmost part of the Kingdom of Norway. Three islands are populated: Spitsbergen, Bjørnøya and Hopen. The largest settlement is Longyearbyen. The Svalbard Treaty recognises Norwegian sovereignty over
. With the 1925 Svalbard Act, Norway chose to make
a part of the Kingdom, and
remains one of five special entities whose status is recognized by international treaty in the world today.
